etymology.description: 關(關) (guān, "close") -> eliminate the 門(門) (mén, "gate") radical -> simplified to 关(關)
etymology.interpretation: The simplification process removed the 門(門) (mén, "gate") radical, leaving only the central component to represent the meaning of 'close' or 'barrier'. This change was primarily a reduction in strokes to streamline writing.
etymology.simplification: This simplification involved removing the 門(門) (mén, "gate") radical to create a more streamlined version by focusing on the central component for phonetic representation.

examples.chinese: 每天睡前他都会关掉电视(每天睡前他都會關掉電視)，以节省能源(以節省能源)。
examples.pinyin: Měitiān shuìqián tā dōu huì guān diào diànshì, yǐ jiéshěng néngyuán.
examples.english: Every night before sleeping, he turns off the TV to save energy.
